Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [surveying an untidy office] The building's custodian is on vacation for the month and Dwight is too cheap to hire a replacement. So, instead, we're living in filth. But, not for long. Because I have created the chore wheel.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [viewing the chore wheel for the first time] Oh, yeah! Can I spin first?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't spin. We'll just move the wheel one notch each morning and... you see what chore you get that day.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: A wheel is supposed to spin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know, like [motions arm in circles] guh, guh, guh, guh, guh, guh, guh... guh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm familiar with spinning. It's just that wouldn't work with a chore wheel because people might get the same chore-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [interrupting] Bugh, boring. All she talks about is chores.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: A wheel wants to spin, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reluctantly] Spinning would be more fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [frustrated] 'Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [spinning a new 'chore wheel' while everyone claps] Okay, that's what I'm talking about! Big money, big money! [wheel stops on 'mug duty', disappointed] Mug duty?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, you clean all the mugs in the sink.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, seriously, it's like everything on there is work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think you guys understand why we're doing this. It's-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't think that you understand wheels.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've been through several rounds of development with the team and here's where we stand with the chore wheel. [introducing a third 'chore wheel', excited] We've got prizes! Ten bucks, candy bar, manager for an hour but, there are also penalties. Like, no internet, Stanley gets your lunch. The one thing that is not on the chore wheel is chores. But they were right; it's more fun this way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [everyone cheers as Meredith spins and lands on 'tiny wheel'] The tiny wheel actually does have chores. It's so cute no one seems to mind.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [referencing the 'tiny wheel'] Toilets! [everyone cheers as Meredith accepts her chore]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [at the Halpert residence as Cece twirls in the front yard, exiting front door] Pam, we gotta go. Cece, go back inside. Grandma's got breakfast, OK? [to camera] We are going to Roy's wedding. Yep, Roy. I think the only weird thing about going to your wife's ex-fiancé's wedding on a weekday at eight AM is that it's your wife's ex-fiancé.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [exiting house] Thanks, mom!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] A banana?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm afraid he's only gonna have hot dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. Not even Roy will have hot dogs at his wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Planned a wedding with him. He wanted hot dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera] Just... so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [as Pete and Clark enter office] Oh, Pete, you've got mail.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Really? I got something?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, it's addressed to Customer Service so, it's your mail.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, you know, I'm also Customer Service.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm alternating. [gestures both men]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Yay, another person yelling at me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, it could be a nice letter. I write nice letters to companies all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: That's really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [looking down at Erin's desk] Wow, Newsweek, huh? This election... thing is crazy, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [referring to the letter] It's open.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, I accidentally read it. It's not a nice letter.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [whispering] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [distributing paperwork to the office] Get excited. The special projects fairy has arrived.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I know you don't really exist.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Today, I launch my big charity initiative 'Operation Give Back'. Andy has shot down all of my special projects thus far but, this one is about charity. So, I'd like to see him piss on that one.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [at Roy's wedding] Darryl! Ha-ha! What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Congratulations, baby!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Ah, thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Pam approaching the wedding venue] Is this his house?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Think so.

Quote.Speaker: Server
Quote.Text: [approaching Jim and Pam] Mimosa?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [taking glass] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Server
Quote.Text: Would you like me to take your peel?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [embarrassed] Yes, thank you. [finishes banana and hands server the peel]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [as Jim receives and declines a call] Who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, my ex-fiancé.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Ha-ha.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I started a new business with my college friend. But, Pam doesn't know. Um... actually I did tell Pam and we decided 'no'. But, then I decided 'yes' anyway. So, I'm thinking there's another conversation coming. And, it's hard to know when that will be.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: With Operation Give Back, you pick the charities Dunder-Mifflin supports.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [grinning] Oh boy! What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: There's four thousand dollars to give away. So, who has filled out their form? Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: American Diabetes Association.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Um, you have diabetes, Stanley. [to Nellie] I'm sorry, is the assignment to pick a selfish charity?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I w-, uh, I would love to give uh-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [excited] Heifer's International. Listen to this. They give a poor person like, a goat or something. It's a great prank.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I wanna work with, uh, Jimmy Carter and help build gnomes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, what about you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will not be participating as there is no evidence that charity works.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, correction, I give to a foundation that teaches homeless children nautical flag signaling. Changes lives.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Thank you, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not doing it for you. I'm doing it for the preservation of nautical flag signaling.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, you will be participating.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Participation is mandatory; Dwight, but you can choose whatever cause you like.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine, I chose the Global Relief Foundation.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Great, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which was recently discovered to be a front for the Taliban.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [everyone groans] Oh, for goodness' sake, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. The Taliban in Afa-ghanistan.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: The Taliban is the worst. Great heroine, though.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, I cannot have the Taliban on the roster of Operation Give Back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, it looks like there won't be any Operation Give Back. Ha, ha. The nanny state is over, ladies and gentlemen. You're welcome. [wads up Nellie's charity sheet and tosses it toward her]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [approaches Roy back at the wedding] There he is. Is it almost time to cut the pancake, or what?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Aw, yeah, god, we appreciate everyone coming so early. It's, everyone's just been so nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks for inviting us, by the way-

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was, that was a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on. If it wasn't for you, I never would've met Laura. I mean, seriously, kinda dodged a bullet on that one. [sees Jim's reaction] Just kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Thanks...aw.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: By the way, man, this place is... beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Started a gravel company. I mean, who knew it'd take off?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gravel company?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah. What about you? What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not gravel, obviously. [both chuckle] No, things are good. Things are good. Got some stuff in the works. So-

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Oh, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you never know.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Hey bro, stop wasting time with this haircut. [referring to Jim] He's got a fifty-thousand dollar sports car. Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, Kenny.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [talking on phone] Duncan, listen, I would love to help you out but where am I gonna find somebody that's pretty, smart and well-informed? Huh? Hold on, hold on. [covers phone's receiver] Erin, do you know anybody that might want... [has realization] Oh my gosh. You love the news, right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, it depends. I mean, sometimes I find out things that are really sad.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, I got a buddy that's a big time local news producer and I can't tell you his name, but it'd blow your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Uh, is it Duncan?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: He's looking for on-air talent and he'd kill me if I didn't get you on tape.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You mean, put me on the news?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You'll just come over, put on little lipstick, loosen up with a glass of red wine and then we'll just run through a few stories. You know, a couple different ways, with a couple different outfits. It'd be really tasteful and it'd really help me out with Duncan... with my friend. [Erin considers] What do you say? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Maybe, ok? Let me think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [Pete looks on disappointed] Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Think it over. [punches Pete]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No, Clark's not my friend. He is the douche that sits next to me at the office. My friends are Scott, Glenn, and Rob. But, you don't know them.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I never really thought much about being more than a receptionist. But, why? Because I happened to answer help wanted ad to be a receptionist? I mean, what if the ad had been for a CEO? Or for a brain surgeon?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So, ah, it was a year ago today that I met Laura. I thought she was my waitress and, uh, took her three weeks to tell me that she actually owned the place. You are full of surprises. You are my beautiful mystery girl. And, today, I have a surprise for you. [approaches piano]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He plays piano?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. Roy? No.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You know how I said I was taking boxing lessons? Actually, I was doing this. Um, so, I hope that you like it. [sits in front of piano]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [clapping] You got this, Roy. [Roy begins playing and singing She's Got a Way by Billy Joel, Pam and Jim looked shocked, Phyllis and Bob begin making out]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in the car] We still surprise each other.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I never did it, but for your 30th birthday I really wanted to surprise you with-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Courtside seats. Sixers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. But, what I didn't tell you is that I actually bought the tickets. We only didn't go because it was-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was an away game.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: In Phoenix. They should really tell you that more specifically. I mean, every game is an away game for one of the teams. [long pause] Do we know everything about each other?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell me one thing about you I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] Um, ok. [thinks but says nothing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in the kitchen] Oh, here's one. Did I ever tell you about the time that my brothers videotaped the lottery announcement? And bought the winning numbers the next day? And then, played the tape for me the next week, and I-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And you thought you guys were millionaires.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You heard that one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. But there's, wait, oh, there's a funny ending to that story. I can't remember.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That I thought we were millionaires.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thought you were millionaires, yeah. That's funny. Shoot, I knew that one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The senator and I still have mystery. I'm always waiting to see what he's gonna surprise me with next. [Oscar chokes on his coffee]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You all right? [Oscar nods]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You support the Taliban abroad. So I assume you're willing to live by their rules here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Anything else would be inconsistent.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Will you join me then in a pledge to live by Taliban law in this office? [offers Dwight a contract]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [takes contract] Absolutely, I will.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I feared Nellie had some sort of a plan but she used a ridiculous font. Huh. [in a fake English accent] You don't have a plan.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: When you use a ridiculous font, no one thinks you have a plan.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [holds up pen as Dwight searches his desk] Looking for this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What the? [follows Nellie into the break room]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, this is a lovely pen. Ah. But, it's mine now because I stole it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [taking pen back] Gimme that.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Didn't you sign a contract to live under Taliban law? And now, there's been theft. That means, you're not serious or... someone's getting their hand cut off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're insane.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I know. So, it's better that you pick another charity.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, and let your precious Operation Power Grab proceed unchecked? No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: In that case, you... [pulls out a cleaver] will have to chop off my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [considers then takes cleaver] This cleaver appears to need sharpening. I suggest you spend some quality time together just you and your hand. Tie a shoe, toss a salad. Do any of the two hand activities that you'll miss the most.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I tell you what. I need to make three calls. And then after that, you can become a person who chops off people's hands.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sounds like a plan.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in his office] Clark wants to film you in different outfits inside his apartment?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [entering annex] Clark, you and I need to have a little chat. What clothes does Erin need for this news audition?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Uh... couple of button-downs, a camisole, a blazer, a pencil skirt, stilettos, maybe, no, no, not maybe, definitely open-toed. Uh, something low-cut because the camera makes everything seem higher cut.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah, industry secret. You're gonna want some of those panty hose with the seam up the back.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Seems unnecessary for an audition.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: And then, you know, maybe just a robe to wear in between takes but I probably got one she can borrow at my place, so-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank god someone here knows what their talking about. I want you to take this credit card, take Erin to the mall and get that stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I absolutely will do that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awesome. [to Pete] Plop!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Pff. Guess I'll just head over to the mall then. Buy Erin some sexy, fun outfits.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: That Clark, huh? Errr [punches palm] Ca!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [in kitchen with several people around] Next question for our oldie-weds-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's the craziest place you've ever made whoopie?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Language.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Who was Pam's first celebrity crush?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam's first celebrity crush.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [whispering] John Stamos.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as he and Pam flip their cards] John Stamos.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. But John Stamos was temporary. I quickly moved on to-

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Johnny Depp.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Johnny Depp. [everyone looks confused toward Toby]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [after awkward pause] Sh, uh, um, I was having this separate conversation with Kevin. Uh, Johnny Depp.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Totally. George Clooney.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: OK, I have one. I have one. [Jim's phone rings and he motions he's taking the call elsewhere]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [while Angela tries asking a question] What is the craziest place you've ever made whoopie?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [as Pam wonders about Jim] Kevin, stop it with that question.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in the stairwell on his phone] Right. And did you show them the market? Yeah. And what'd they say? That's awesome! That, oh my god! Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not even real yet. And I'm not gonna tell her 'til it's real.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think maybe there actually is something I don't know about Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Everyone, we have a voluntary meeting in the conference room to discuss Erin's confidence.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Her body. We're gonna talk about her body. [to Darryl] Good. Great job.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy made me his consigliere. Which means Assistant Regional Manager. I guess he thought I'd be into The Godfather 'cause I'm black. Wrong! I'm into The Godfather 'cause I'm a cinephile. I like Scarface 'cause I'm black.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to a full conference room] Erin has an audition to be a newscaster. [general acknowledgement]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh-huh. And I want her to feel very comfortable in her very sexy skin. So, everybody say something that you like about her body. All right? Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK, um, I like Erin's hair. It's a very pretty color.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. This is for a news audition?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Then why are we talking about her looks? Why not her credibility? Or her reliability?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: News flash everyone. The human race finds attractive people more trustworthy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, Andy, but for twenty years, the most trusted man in America - Walter Cronkite.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Cronkite was hot. If I could go back in time, I'd take that mustache ride.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Does Erin have any experience? Has she taken any journalism classes, maybe? Or...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Has she done the pageant circuit?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, I watch the news.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's gonna be amazing. Look at her. She's gonna light up the screen.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This is a first for me. And, I don't get a lot of chances, so I have to take them really seriously. I will do whatever it takes to get the job.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [whispering to Pete] Whatever it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [whispering] Yeah, I know, I heard. I heard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [places Nellie's hand on a board and holds up cleaver] This is it. Any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Is it gonna be long?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. It's gonna be over before you know it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [pretending to read news] Afghan president Hamid Karzai declared a new policy of dollar days throughout the country. Promising low, low prices on all 2012 Kia Sentras and Sonatas. Aren't you glad you waited? Karzai commented.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Um, where did you get that story?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A little bit here, a little bit there. I bet you didn't think I knew current events.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I love it. It's fantastic. Now, tag it with your name.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: For Channel 11 news, I'm Erin Hannon.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pause after 'news'.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: For Channel 11 news... I'm Erin Hannon.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, pause longer.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was a good one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pause, pause longer. OK? Builds suspense. Don't be shy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Got it. For Channel 11 news... [very long pause]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wha, it's-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm Erin Hannon.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. All right. Great. Some great stuff in there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Pam stares at him] I can feel you looking at me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. Well, here's something you don't know. A couple of weeks ago-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I ran into this guy from my high school who has just gotten divorced and he hit on me. In the mall. And I didn't tell you because, I don't know, I felt embarrassed. And, I didn't know if you would be mad or worried. But, anyway, I thought you'd want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after a pause] That didn't happen. You would've told me right away.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I would've. What about you? Come on, there's gotta be something. Between your birth and the last two days, something you just haven't had the chance to tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh... [looks at Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looks knowingly back] Just tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: God, give it up, Beesley. You know me too well.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Heh! Ha! [making various sounds and movements while preparing to severe Nellie's hand] [Darryl enters, sees what's happening, and quietly exits]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey, um, I knew something bothered me and I finally figured it out. What news producers are gonna want to see is how Erin relates to the other people on the news team.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: The weird thing is Erin is doing the audition alone.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Now, I'd say Clark could be your co-host... he's already doing camera.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Tuh.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Someone who's already got rapport with Erin, maybe. I don't know. [Andy smiles at camera]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha! [raises cleaver] This is for real this time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's getting late. I thought you guys could use a little [sets up laptop] inspiration.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [Darryl hits play] Oh, a movie. What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: 127 hours. It's about this guy who-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no. No spoilers. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Goodnight.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [answers his door to find Erin, Andy and Pete] Hey! Everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Come in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Come on in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [to Pete] What're you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Sorry, man. Andy though Erin needed a co-anchor. I'm his makeup guy. My hands are tied.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [news anchor audition] The victim was released from the hospital with second-degree burns.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [also as anchor] Wow. You know what they say Erin. If you can't take the heat, get out of the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, he tried to but the fire door was blocked.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He sure did.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: All right. We got that. That's a rap, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Aw!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just, you sure Clark?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yep, she's done.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I just, I don't mean Erin. I mean for me. I didn't feel good about that.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No, we got it. We got it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Great! Let's get some food. I'm starving.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't think we did get it. I could do, uh, a couple more takes. We could do it in close-up. That might even be better for editing.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: OK, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, Pete, you wanna take Erin to get a burger or something?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah, whatever you say, boss.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. [to Erin] I'll call you later.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Clark] So this is a single.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, even if this doesn't work out for me, I'm just glad I had the guts to do it. And, maybe it'll work out for Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as he and Nellie watch the movie] Oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That is absolutely revolting!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: He is so good, though.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The way he just cuts off his arm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you like James Franco, we really should watch Rise of the Planet of the Apes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, he's a genius, you know? He was in graduate programs at Yale, Columbia and NYU all at the same time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoopty doo. That doesn't make you a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't make you stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, it does, actually. It makes you real stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Stupid like you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, like you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Like you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're the stupid one.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You're the stupid one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're the stupid one.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You're the stupid one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You, you, you, you...
